cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi (195 km) SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, expected to turn north then north-northeast and track across eastern North Carolina, southeastern Virginia and the Delmarva Peninsula toward the northern Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern North Carolina coast (near Surf City–Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Surf City NC to Bogue Inlet NC and remaining portions of Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach; Storm Surge Warning: Bogue Inlet NC to Chincoteague VA, Chesapeake Bay south of Colonial Beach VA, Neuse & Pamlico Rivers
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North Carolina through New Jersey including Chesapeake and Delaware Bays
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 20–35 mph with occasional higher gusts (near gale force) possible Saturday night into Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay, including the Baltimore harbor approaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal flooding, elevated waves and hazardous marine conditions in Chesapeake Bay; low tornado risk.
